Headline: Tripura Floods Caused Damages Worth Rs 15,000 Crore: Chief Minister
Content: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha on Saturday said the unprecedented floods in the state have caused an estimated loss of Rs 15,000 crore, affecting infrastructure, agriculture, and other property.

Headline: Bangladesh's Worst Floods Leave 5 Million Stranded Amid Political Turmoil
Content: About five million people in Bangladesh were stranded by floods in low-lying areas, as strong currents washed away river embankments.

Headline: 11 dead, 14 Missing After Heavy Rains Trigger Floods In China: Report
Content: Eleven people have been killed and 14 more are missing after heavy rain in recent days lashed China's northeastern province of Liaoning, state broadcaster CCTV reported Friday.

Headline: Tripura Chief Minister Takes Aerial Survey As Flood Situation Improves
Content: The flood situation in Tripura, which witnessed catastrophic monsoon deluge for the first time in over three decades, slightly improved on Friday but vast areas including human habitations in urban and rural areas, still inundated.

Headline: 2 Dead, Nearly 3 Million Stranded In Deadly Bangladesh Floods
Content: Relentless monsoon rains and flooding have stranded nearly three million people in Bangladesh and killed two, submerging vast areas and damaging homes and infrastructure, officials from the country's disaster management ministry said on Thursday.

Headline: Tripura Floods: 7 Of Two Families Killed In landslides Due To Heavy Rain
Content: This increase follows the deaths of at least seven more people from two families, including three women and a child, who were killed in landslides. The state is experiencing its most severe monsoon flooding in over 30 years.

Headline: 19 Dead, 17 Lakh People Affected In Tripura Floods Fury
Content: The flood situation in Tripura, which has been lashed by heavy rains over the last four days, remained grim on Thursday.

Headline: "Not Correct...": Government On Reports India Dam Caused Bangladesh Floods
Content: Flooding in the eastern districts of Bangladesh were not caused by the opening of a dam on the Gumti River in Tripura, the government clarified Thursday.

Headline: 10 Dead, Several Missing After Flash Floods In Tripura
Content: As many as 10 people have died and more than 34,000 have been displaced amid a worsening disaster situation in Tripura on Wednesday, officials have said.

Headline: Why Experts Have Been Sent To 6 High-Risk Glacial Lakes In Arunachal Pradesh
Content: Two teams of experts have been sent to six high-risk glacial lakes in Arunachal for the first time to assess the possibility of glacial lake outburst floods (GLOF) and ways to access these water bodies for mitigation measures, official sources said.

Headline: 7 Dead, Thousands Affected Due To Flash Floods In Tripura
Content: At least seven people have died in flash floods across Tripura after water levels of several rivers rose suddenly due to incessant rainfall for over 48 hours.

Headline: Auto, School Bus Get Stuck In Waterlogged Delhi Underpass, 3 Rescued
Content: The Minto Bridge underpass is infamous for waterlogging during monsoon. In July 2020, a man drowned after his mini-truck got stuck in the underpass.

Headline: How Extreme Weather Is Leading To Rise In Child Marriages In Pakistan
Content: As monsoon rains were about to break over Pakistan, 14-year-old Shamila and her 13-year-old sister Amina were married off in exchange for money, a decision their parents made to help the family survive the threat of floods.

Headline: iPhone Vs Samsung Debate Gets A Comic Twist In This Viral Video
Content: The video humorously highlights the differences between the two tech giants, leading to a flood of discussions about their features.

Headline: Explained: How Karnataka's Tungabhadra Dam Gate Washed Away
Content: Anticipating a potential threat from the Tungabhadra Reservoir in Karnataka's Vijayanagara district, the Andhra Pradesh government has issued a flood alert in low-lying areas of the Kurnool district.
